message.content:
cs.AR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.ET

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper proposes a new encoding technique for PCM that can be implemented on-chip with only a nominal area overhead. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper discusses encoding techniques and compression methods for PCM, which are related to data structures and algorithms. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a new Word-Level Compression (WLC) technique that compresses more than 91% of the memory lines and provides enough room to store the auxiliary data using a novel restricted coset encoding applied at small data block granularities. This is related to information theory. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper discusses techniques to reduce write energy for PCM, which is related to system optimization and control. 
- cs.ET (Embedded Systems): The proposed encoding technique can be implemented on-chip, which is related to embedded systems.
